question: What is the purpose of Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) Password Protection?
options: To control how often users must change their passwords
To identify devices which users can sign into without using multi-factor authentication (MFA)
To encrypt a password using globally-recognised encryption standards
To prevent users from using specific words in their passwords
correctAnswer: To prevent users from using specific words in their passwords

question: Which Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) feature can you use to evaluate group membership and automatically remove users that no longer require membership in a group?
_______ requires additional verification, such as a verification code sent to a mobile phone.
Conditional access policies can use the device state as a signal.
Conditional access policies apply before first-factor authentication is complete.
Conditional access policies can trigger multi-factor authentication (MFA) if a user attempts to access a specific application.
Microsoft Defender for Identity can identify advanced threats from _______.
options: On-premises Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS)
correctAnswer: On-premises Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS)

question: Which Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) feature can you use to provide just-in-time (JIT) access to manage Azure resources?
Which three authentication methods can be used by Azure Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)?
Which Microsoft 365 feature can you use to restrict communication and the sharing of information between members of two departments at your organisation?
Conditional access policies always enforce the use of multi-factor authentication (MFA).
Conditional access policies can be used to block access to an application based on the location of the user.
Conditional access policies only affect users who have Azure Active Directory-joined devices.
Which three authentication methods does Windows Hello for Business support?
Which service will allow you to implement approval-based, time-bound role activation?
When security defaults are enabled for an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenant, which two requirements are enforced?
options: All users must authenticate from a registered device
Administrators must always use Azure Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
Azure Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) registration is required for all users
All users must authenticate by using passwordless sign-in
All users must authenticate by using Windows Hello
correctAnswer: Administrators must always use Azure Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
Azure Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) registration is required for all users

question: Which type of identity is created when you register an application with Azure AD?
Which three tasks can be performed by using Azure AD Identity Protection?
options: Configure external access for partner organisations
Export risk detection to third-party utilities
Automate the detection and remediation of identity-based risks
Investigate risks that relate to user authentication
Create and automatically assign sensitivity labels to data
correctAnswer: Automate the detection and remediation of identity-based risks
Investigate risks that relate to user authentication
Create and automatically assign sensitivity labels to data

question: Windows Hello for Business can use the Microsoft Authenticator app as an authentication method.
Windows Hello for Business can use a PIN code as an authentication method.
Windows Hello for Business authentication information syncs across all the devices registered by a user.
An Azure resource can use a system-assigned _______ to access Azure services.
You can use _______ in the Microsoft 365 Defender portal to identify devices that are affected by an alert.
What are two capabilities of Microsoft Defender for Endpoint?
When using multi-factor authentication (MFA), a password is considered something you _______.
What is the primary function of Microsoft Entra ID Conditional Access?
options: Monitoring and reporting on security incidents and potential threats across Azure resources
Enforcing policies that control how and when users can access applications and data
Managing encryption keys and ensure data integrity across cloud services
Providing automated threat detection and response capabilities for endpoint devices
correctAnswer: To enforce policies that control how and when users can access applications and data

question: Which of the following describes the primary purpose of Microsoft Defender for Endpoint?
options: Providing identity and access management solutions for cloud and on-premises applications
Ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory standards by providing tools for data governance
Protecting endpoints by detecting, preventing, investigating, and responding to advanced threats
Facilitating secure collaboration and information sharing across organisational boundaries
correctAnswer: Protecting endpoints by detecting, preventing, investigating, and responding to advanced threats

question: Which two of the following are features of Microsoft Purview Information Protection?

_______ is a cloud-native security information and event management (SIEM) and security orchestration automated response (SOAR) solution used to provide a single solution for alert detection, threat visibility, proactive hunting, and threat response.
Azure Defender can detect vulnerabilities and threats for Azure Storage.
Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) is available for all Azure subscriptions.
Azure Security Centre can evaluate the security of workloads deployed to Azure or on-premises.
You can use _______ in the Microsoft 365 security centre to view an aggregation of alerts that relate to the same attack.
You can create one Azure Bastion per virtual network.
Azure Bastion provides secure user connections by using RDP
Azure Bastion provides a secure connection to an Azure virtual machine by using the Azure portal.
Which feature in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint provides the first line of defense against cyberthreats by reducing the attack surface?
In Microsoft Sentinel, you can automate common tasks by using _______.
Which two types of resources can be protected by using Azure Firewall?
You plan to implement a security strategy and place multiple layers of defense throughout a network infrastructure. Which security methodology does this represent?
What can you use to scan email attachments and forward the attachments to recipients only if the attachments are free from malware?
Which feature provides the extended detection and response (XDR) capability of Azure Sentinel?
options: Integration with the Microsoft 365 compliance centre

question: What can you use to provide threat detection for Azure SQL Managed Instance?

You have a Microsoft 365 E3 subscription. You plan to audit user activity by using the unified audit log and Basic Audit. For how long will the audit records be retained?
To which type of resource can Azure Bastion provide secure access?
What are three uses of Microsoft Cloud App Security?
options: To discover and control the use of shadow IT
To provide secure connections to Azure virtual machines
To protect sensitive information hosted anywhere in the cloud
To provide pass-through authentication to on-premises applications
To prevent data leaks to noncompliant apps and limit access to regulated data
correctAnswer: To discover and control the use of shadow IT
To protect sensitive information hosted anywhere in the cloud
To prevent data leaks to noncompliant apps and limit access to regulated data
